questions: What is the Startup Name?
When was the startup Date Started?
What is the Registration Type?
What is the Registration Country?
What is the Contact Info?
How many team members do you have?
List the team members with the following details:

questions.Name: What is the team member's name?
questions.Title: What is the team member's title?
questions.Availability Per Week: How many hours per week is the team member available?
questions.Involved Since: Since when has the team member been involved?
questions.Equity %: What percentage of equity does the team member hold?
questions.Salary %: What percentage of salary does the team member receive?
questions.Years of Experience: How many years of experience does the team member have?

Academic Degree.Undergraduate: Does the team member have an undergraduate degree?
Academic Degree.Graduate Degree: Does the team member have a graduate degree?
Academic Degree.Masters: Does the team member have a master's degree?
Academic Degree.PhD or More: Does the team member have a PhD or higher degree?

Startup Experience.Has Been Part of a Startup Team: Has the team member been part of a startup team?
Startup Experience.Has Been the Founder of a Startup: Has the team member been the founder of a startup?
Startup Experience.Has Previous C-Level Position: Has the team member held a previous C-level position?
Startup Experience.Has Been Part of a Successful Exit: Has the team member been part of a successful exit?

Role.Marketing: Is the team member's role in Marketing?
Role.Sales: Is the team member's role in Sales?
Role.Product: Is the team member's role in Product?
Role.Creative: Is the team member's role in Creative?
Role.Technical: Is the team member's role in Technical?
Role.Operation: Is the team member's role in Operation?
Role.Other: What other role does the team member have?

questions: Can you provide an overview of the team’s qualifications and expertise?
How would you assess the team’s experience and ability to execute the business plan?
How much are you currently raising?
How much have you raised so far?
What are the sources of your funds?

questions.Friends and Family: Are the funds from Friends and Family?
questions.Accelerator: Are the funds from an Accelerator?
questions.Angel Investor: Are the funds from an Angel Investor?
questions.VC: Are the funds from a VC?

questions: How are you planning to spend the funds being raised?

questions.Product: Will the funds be spent on Product?
questions.Marketing: Will the funds be spent on Marketing?
questions.Team: Will the funds be spent on Team?
questions.Operations: Will the funds be spent on Operations?

questions: Have you received any patents?
Have you accomplished any significant achievements?
Is your pitch deck ready?
What are consumers currently paying (on an annual basis) to resolve this problem or satisfy this desire?
How big is your market in numbers?
What market share are you planning to acquire in the next 3 years?
What is your primary industry?
What are you charging for?

questions.Capital: Are you charging for Capital (Real Estate or Cash)?
questions.Data / Information: Are you charging for Data / Information?
questions.Goods / Widgets (Resellers): Are you charging for Goods / Widgets (Resellers)?
questions.Goods / Widgets (Producers): Are you charging for Goods / Widgets (Producers)?
questions.Hard Science: Are you charging for Hard Science (BioTech, Pharma, AI, etc.)?
questions.Network or Community: Are you charging for Network or Community?
questions.Non-Physical Direct to Consumer: Are you charging for Non-Physical Direct to Consumer (in-app purchases, Freemium, etc.)?
questions.Physical Direct to Consumer: Are you charging for Physical Direct to Consumer (monthly deliveries, etc.)?
questions.Services: Are you charging for Services (health care, professional services, legal services, etc.)?
questions.Technology / Platform: Are you charging for Technology / Platform?
questions.Other: What other charges are you applying?

questions: Which of the following best describes the primary way your venture will make money?

questions.Advertising: Is your revenue model based on Advertising?
questions.Pay Per Unit: Is your revenue model based on Pay Per Unit?
questions.Pay Per Project: Is your revenue model based on Pay Per Project?

Brokerage or Marketplace.Consumer to Consumer: Is your marketplace model Consumer to Consumer (e.g. Airbnb)?
Brokerage or Marketplace.Enterprise to Enterprise: Is your marketplace model Enterprise to Enterprise (e.g. New York Stock Exchange)?
Brokerage or Marketplace.Enterprise to Consumer: Is your marketplace model Enterprise to Consumer (e.g. Amazon)?

questions.Recurring: Is your revenue model Recurring (Rental, Subscription, Premiums, etc.)?
questions.Other: What other revenue model are you using?

questions: What is your primary way of acquiring customers?

questions.Virtual / Word of Mouth: Are you using Virtual / Word of Mouth?

questions: How much do you have to spend on Sales & Marketing to acquire each customer as a percentage of sale value?
What kind of users make up your audience/user base?
What is the current stage of development for the product?

questions.Idea: Is the product at the Idea stage?
questions.Prototype: Is the product at the Prototype stage?
questions.Beta: Is the product at the Beta stage?
questions.Live: Is the product at the Live stage?

questions: How many prospective customers have you interviewed in the past 3 months?
What percentage of these prospects said they would purchase the product or service?
Have you already started making sales and generating revenues?
How much revenue have you realized over the past twelve months?
How much revenue have you realized over the past three months?
How many individual leads have resulted in these sales?
